webpage.para: Here are some screenshots of the development version:

simplelist.member: The new text tool is shaping up and thanks to Pango it also handles arabic scripts quite nicely.
GIMP runs on MacOS X and Win32 as well.
Standard document sizes are available as templates now.
Almost all GIMP windows can be grouped together using the GIMP docks.
The brush shaped cursor shows the area that will be affected by the next paint operation.
If you need to do pixel-precise work, you will like the new image grid.
The File Open dialog shows a nicer preview now thanks to the adaption of the Free Desktop Thumbnail Managing Standard.
Almost all changes done in the Preferences dialog apply instantly.
Starting with version 1.3.21, The GIMP allows to export paths as Scalable Vector Graphics and it also imports SVG.
